py.youtube_api module¶

class youtube_api.YoutubeDataApi(key)¶

Bases: object

The Youtube Data API handles the keys and methods to access data from the YouTube Data API

get_captions(video_id, lang_code='en', verbose=1, parser=<function parse_caption_track>)¶

Grabs captions given a video id using the PyTube and BeautifulSoup Packages.s

get_channel_id_from_user(username, verbose=1)¶

Get a channel_id from a YouTube username. To get video_ids from the channel_id, you need to get the “upload playlist id”. This can be done using get_upload_playlist() for get_channel_metadata().

Parameters:
  • username – the username for a YouTube channel
  • verbose – error handling
Returns:

the YouTube channel id for the given username
get_channel_metadata(channel_id, verbose=1, parser=<function parse_channel_metadata>)¶

Gets a dictionary of channel metadata given a channel_id, or a list of channel_ids.

input channel_id (str or list of str) the channel id(s) key (str) the API key to the Youtube Data API.

get_featured_channels(channel_id, verbose=1, parser=<function parse_featured_channels>)¶

Given a channel_id (str) returns a dictionary {channel_id : [list, of, channel_ids]} of featured channels.

Optionally, can take a list of channel IDS, and returns a list of dictionaries.

get_playlists(channel_id, next_page_token=False, verbose=1, parser=<function parse_playlist_metadata>)¶

Returns a list of playlist IDs that channel_id created. Note that playlists can contains videos from any users.

inputs channel_id (str) a channel_id IE:UCn8zNIfYAQNdrFRrr8oibKw next_page_token (str) a token to continue from a preciously stopped query IE:CDIQAA verbose (int) determines how errors are printed to the system. 1 is print 2 is log 0 is silent.

return playlists (list of dicts) of playlist IDs that channel_id is subscribed to.

get_recommended_videos(video_id, max_results=25, parser=<function parse_rec_video_metadata>, verbose=1)¶

TODO: WRITE DOCs

get_subscriptions(channel_id, next_page_token=False, parser=<function parse_subscription_descriptive>, verbose=1)¶

Returns a list of channel IDs that channel_id is subscribed to.

inputs channel_id (str) a channel_id IE:UCn8zNIfYAQNdrFRrr8oibKw key (str) the API key to the Youtube Data API. next_page_token (str) a token to continue from a preciously stopped query IE:CDIQAA descriptive (bool) if set to True will return additional metadata about a subscription stop_after_n_iteration (int) stops the API calls after N API calls verbose (int) determines how errors are printed to the system. 1 is print 2 is log 0 is silent.

return subscription_ids (list) of channel IDs that channel_id is subscrbed to.

get_video_comments(video_id, get_replies=True, cutoff_date=datetime.datetime(1990, 1, 1, 0, 0), verbose=1, parser=<function parse_comment_metadata>)¶

Returns a list of comments on a given video

inputs video_id (str) a vide_id IE: eqwPlwHSL_M get_replies (bool) whether or not to get replies to comments key (str) the API key to the Youtube Data API. stop_after_n_iteration (int) stops the API calls after N API calls cutoff_date (datetime) a date for the minimum publish date for comments from a video_id. verbose (int) determines how errors are printed to the system. 1 is print 2 is log 0 is silent.

return comments (list of dicts) of comments from the comments section on a given video_id

get_video_metadata(video_id, verbose=1, parser=<function parse_video_metadata>)¶

Given a video_id returns metrics (views, likes, comments) and metadata (description, category) as a dictionary.

inputs video_id (str or list of str) the ID of a video IE:kNbhUWLH_yY, this can be found at the end of Youtube urls and by parsing links using get_youtube_id() key (str) the API key to the Youtube Data API. verbose (int) determines how errors are printed to the system. 1 is print 2 is log 0 is silent.

returns video_ids (str or list of str) a list of dictionaries containing metadata.

get_video_urls_from_playlist_id(playlist_id, next_page_token=False, cutoff_date=datetime.datetime(1990, 1, 1, 0, 0), verbose=1, parser=<function parse_video_url>)¶

Given a playlist_id, returns a list of video_ids associated with that playlist. Note that to user uploads are a playlist from channels. Typically this pattern is just the channel ID with UU subbed as the first two letters. You can access this using the function get_upload_playlist_id, or from the playlist_id_likes key returned from get_channel_metadata.

inputs playlist_id (str) the playlist_id IE:UUaLfMkkHhSA_LaCta0BzyhQ key (str) the API key to the Youtube Data API. next_page_token (str) a token to continue from a preciously stopped query IE:CDIQAA stop_after_n_iteration (int) stops the API calls after N API calls cutoff_date (datetime) a date for the minimum publish date for videos from a playlist_id. return_date (bool) if set to False only return video_ids verbose (int) determines how errors are printed to the system. 1 is print 2 is log 0 is silent.

returns video_ids (list of str) a list of video ids associated with playlist_id.

youtube_api.random_function(arg)¶

This is a random function for doc building test :param arg: is meaningless

py.youtube_api_utils module¶

youtube_api_utils.get_channel_id_from_custom_url(url)¶

Gets channel id from a url of a custom url IE: http://youtube.com/stefbot returns a channel_id IE: UCuMo0RRtnNDuMB8DV5stEag

youtube_api_utils.get_liked_playlist_id(channel_id)¶

Given a channel_id, returns the user liked playlist id.

youtube_api_utils.get_upload_playlist_id(channel_id)¶

Given a channel_id, returns the user uploaded playlist id.

Loads the response to json, and checks for errors.

youtube_api_utils.log(msg, verbose=1)¶

Defaults to print, Will be silent it verbose = 0, Will write to a logger if verbose = 1

Module contents¶

pylib: rapid testing and development utils

this module uses apipkg.py for lazy-loading sub modules and classes. The initpkg-dictionary below specifies name->value mappings where value can be another namespace dictionary or an import path.
